Job Title: Director, Product Management

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Marketing, Product Management

Description:
About Us

Ritchie Bros. (NYSE and TSX: RBA) is a global asset management and disposition company, offering customers end-to-end solutions for buying and selling used heavy equipment, trucks and other assets in numerous industries including construction, transportation, agriculture, energy, oil and gas, mining, and forestry. Our mission is to create compelling business solutions for the world's builders to easily and confidently exchange equipment. Learn more about us at: https://www.ritchiebros.com/

About The Team

Our Technology teams work collaboratively from different locations across the world on multiple eCommerce sites, mobile applications, and automated online auctions. We encourage and celebrate technical innovation and work with some of the industry’s leading technologies and tools.

Every day your work will make a difference in the way we run our business and the in the way customers interact with us.

Job Description

The Director, Product Management will work with key stakeholders across the organization (Sales, Marketing, Customer Support) to develop a holistic vision for a platform that provides a single, common view of an RB customer across all of our marketplaces and services. In this role, this person must define the vision and business case for the delivery of a single customer “repository” as well as the delivery of tools and applications that provide the ability to grow revenue through new customer insights and predictive modeling. In addition, this position is responsible (working with the development teams) for the design, integration, and delivery of these applications – including the selection and management of third-party vendors

ResponsibilitiesDevelop platform vision and product roadmap in accordance with corporate standards and the Company’s strategic plan and the business plans of other departments. Ensure that all departmental staff are aware of and focused on the priority objectives established in the Company’s strategic planLeads and manages dedicated resources to build a centralized platform that provides key operating teams core insights into our customers interaction and engagement across all our marketplaces and services offeringsDrives the growth, profitability, and scalability of customer growth initiatives by identifying customer requirements and helping to guide development priorities to ensure the solutions developed meet the needs and requirements of our customersCollaborates with other functional areas to ensure the successful implementation of platforms applications, and systems that deliver on customer value and achieve RB business objectivesCreate tools that allow our key operating teams to maximize customer engagement with all our marketplaces and services offeringsActively work within the organization to both directly and indirectly guide project and engineering teams and resources to be able to achieve desired solutions.?????Responsible for reporting out key performance indicators of customer growth initiatives and working with steering committee to confirm resources and investments necessary to drive growthProvide industry insights and intelligence to the management team on shifts in key technology trends around personalization, predictive analytics, and delivery methodsDemonstrate sound judgment in solving business problems; generate and objectively evaluate alternative courses of action; demonstrate versatile thinking and make decisions based on factual analysis and a regard for consequences; show good judgment and common senseManage, recruit, hire, and train team members setting performance guidelinesPerform other duties as assigned 
 
Qualifications 10 years’ experience in product management or product development roles and successfully driving resultsStrong computer skills including the ability to learn new systems and to enter data quickly and accuratelyDemonstrated leadership and the ability to take initiativeStrong Problem solving, organizational and time management skillsAble to set priorities and work independently with minimal supervisionA desire to help others learn, someone who takes responsibility to coach and mentor othersGood communication skills - strong on diplomacy, a patient listener, strong written communication skills, proven conflict resolution skillsTeam player, ability to relate to a diverse customer base and workforce, ability to put people at ease and the ability to easily network with othersHigh level of integrity and ethics

Experience Level (if available): Director
